item.title: When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable
item.description:
When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable

Alex Lawson, Social Security Works & Sarah Badawi, Progressive Change Campaign Committee (PCCC) join Thom. Plus Special Panel Guest - Patty Lovera, Food & Water Watch. The Department of Justice is launching an investigation into the Dole Food company - one of the world's largest processors of fresh produce.

item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.title: A Turning Point for China?
item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Trump Strives to Win Key Republican Support
item.description:
Trump Strives to Win Key Republican Support

Billionaire real estate mogul Donald Trump is the presumptive U.S. Republican presidential nominee, but he continues to struggle to win support for his maverick candidacy from key Republican figures. Two Republican presidential contenders Trump defeated in his months-long run to the top of the party's presidential field, Texas Senator Ted Cruz and Florida Senator Marco Rubio, returned to the halls of Congress this week but showed little enthusiasm for Trump.

item.title: Sci-Fi Made Real: Pentagon Unveils Stunning Technology
item.description:
Sci-Fi Made Real: Pentagon Unveils Stunning Technology

Unmanned submarine hunters, gecko-inspired wall climbing material and even "upward falling" containers that spring into action from the ocean floor - that's just a taste of the U.S. military's latest technological innovations on display Wednesday at the Pentagon.

item.title: Former Defense Chief to US: 'Get Serious' on Foreign Policy
item.description:
Former Defense Chief to US: 'Get Serious' on Foreign Policy

A former top U.S. defense official says the leading presidential candidates, as well as voters, need to start taking a long, hard look at the country's foreign policy. "Up until now it's just been goofball stuff and gong show appearances - now it get serious" former Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel told a roundtable discussion Tuesday at the Atlantic Council in Washington.

item.title: Amnesty: Over 140 Dead in Nigeria Military Detention
item.description:
Amnesty: Over 140 Dead in Nigeria Military Detention

Nearly 150 people, including 11 children under the age of six, have died in military detention in Nigeria's northeast this year, according to a new report from Amnesty International. Amnesty said the children, including four babies, were among 149 reported deaths of prisoners held at Giwa barracks, a notorious detention facility in the city of Maiduguri that rights groups have criticized in the past.
